tutorial.title: Meetings Creator
tutorial.descriptionContent: Use your knowledge of classes to instantiate and create functionality for meetings and video calls

executableContent.instructions:
Finley is creating an app that has a focus on meetings and video calls. This app could be useful for remote work and companies that need to communicate with employees. Let's apply our newfound skills and help Finley with creating the functionality for meetings and video calls!.

Let's begin by creating our first class `Meeting`.

1. Create a class `Meeting` and define the code block.

Now that we have a `Meeting` class, let's add the constructor. This defines what properties a new `Meeting` object should have.

1. Add the constructor to the class and include `date`, `time`, and `name` as properties.
2. Set the values of `date`, `time`, and `name` to their respective parameter from the constructor.

files.name: script.js

executableContent.instructions:
To complete the `Meeting` class, let's include a method that sends a notification about a meeting.

1. Create a method `sendNotification` that displays this message in the console:
```
 "This is a reminder that your meeting with " + this.name + " is on " + this.date + " at " + this.time + "."
```

files.name: script.js

executableContent.instructions:
The `Meeting` class is complete, awesome! Finley also needs a class for video calls. It will be very similar to the `Meeting` class with a couple of additions.

1. Create a class `VideoCall` that extends the `Meeting` class.

files.name: script.js

executableContent.instructions:
Next, let's add the constructor for `VideoCall`. 

1. Add the constructor and include `date`, `time`, `name`, and `link` properties.
2. Include `super` for `date`, `time`, and `name` to indicate we are inheriting these properties from the `Meeting` class.
3. Give `link` a value of the `link` parameter from the constructor.

files.name: script.js

hints.title: Hint
hints.content:
Remember you can use the reserved word `super` to access the superclass' properties like this 
```
super(date,time,name)
```

executableContent.instructions:
Now that we've set up the properties for `VideoCall`, let's code a method.

1. Create a method `sendNotificationLink`.
2. Make a call to the *inherited* method `sendNotification`.
3. Display in the console this message:
```
"This is the link to your video meeting: " + this.link;
```

files.name: script.js

hints.title: Hint
hints.content: Use `super` to call the `Meeting` class' method `sendNotification`.

executableContent.instructions:
Let's wrap up the `VideoCall` class by including one more method. This method only belongs to `VideoCall`.

1. Create a method named `test`.
2. Display in the console this message: `"Testing audio and video...success!"` within the test method.

files.name: script.js

executableContent.instructions:
The `Meeting` class and `VideoCall` class are complete, great! Let's create an instance of the `Meeting` class and call its method.

1. Create an instance of `Meeting` in a `firstMeeting` variable.
2. Provide *string* values for the arguments for the meeting date, time, and name of the person to be met.
3. Make a call to `sendNotification` using its class.

files.name: script.js

executableContent.instructions:
Lastly, let's create an instance of the `VideoCall` class.

1. Create an instance of `VideoCall` in a `firstVideo` variable. Feel free to provide any *string* value for the arguments.
2. Execute the `sendNotificationLink` method of `firstVideo`
3. Execute the `test` method of `firstVideo`.

files.name: script.js
